column12: DRIVING APPARATUS FOR TELEVISION COMBINED WITH A VIDEO COMMUNICATION

CONSTITUTION: A driver of a TV with video communication function includes a telephone and remote control receiver(100) for detecting a telephone signal or TV remote control signal, a power and video output controller(200) for controlling power on/off or selecting a video source to be displayed according to power and display mode control signals output from the telephone and remote control signal receiver, and a display(300) for displaying the video source. The driver further has the first switch(SW1) for turning on/off the power supplied to the display under the control of the power and video output controller, and the second switch(SW2) for selectively outputting a video telephone signal, TV RF signal or composite signal of the two signals under the control of the power and video output controller. The driver also includes a telephone controller(400) for performing a control operation required for telephone communication according to a telephone signal output from the telephone and remote control signal receiver, and a TV controller(500) for carrying out a TV control operation according to a TV control signal output from the telephone and remote control signal receiver.

CONSTITUTION: A hard disk(4) stores data of an execution file and an execution related file of an application program. A ROM driver(5) stores an application program. An auxiliary memory(1) temporarily stores execution data of the hard disk(4) and the ROM driver(5). A microcomputer checks whether the power source supplying unit(8) is a battery or an adapter. In the case that the power source supplying unit(8) is a battery, a control unit(2) compares a size of the current execution file with a capacity of the auxiliary memory(1) when a power source quantity is less than a predetermined amount, and stores execution data of the hard disk(4) and the ROM driver(5) in the auxiliary memory(1) successively.

column12: INPUT BUFFER HAVING OPTIMAL SETUP/HOLD TIME ON SEMICONDUCTOR MEMORY DEVICE
column13: PURPOSE: An input buffer having an optimal setup/hold time on a semiconductor is provided to produce a constant setup/hold time and optimize the setup/hold time regardless of changes of manufacturing method, power supply and temperature. CONSTITUTION: In the input buffer having an optimal setup/hold time on a semiconductor, the lengths of lines of a signal 1 from a pad(11) and a signal 2 from another pad(15) equalized. And if two capacitances having the same value are used looking into the pads(11,15), the delay times of the two signals(Signal 1,Signal 2) became the same. These two signals are respectively given to two buffers(12,16) having the same layout. The two signals then go through line delays(13,17) and arrive at a latch(14). The setup/hold time is determined by the difference of the two signals at the latch(14).

column12: / .APPARATUS AND METHOD FOR AUTOMETICALLY REGISTERING LOCATION WHEN POWER TURN ON/OFF
column13: PURPOSE: An apparatus and a method for automatically registering and releasing a location in power on/off in a CT2(Second Generation Cordless Telephone) system are provided to automatically register an initial location when power is turned on and to release the location when power is turned off. CONSTITUTION: A control part in a CT2 terminal checks whether power is turned on(301). If power is turned on, the control part executes self-diagnosis and initialization(302) and transmits an initial location registration signal to a WPBX(Wireless Private Branch eXchange)(303). A management part periodically monitors whether an initial location registration signal is received from the WPBX(311). If the initial location registration signal is received through the WPBX from the CT2 terminal, the management part detects a mobile station authentication code from the received signal. The management part searches a database to check whether an identical mobile station authentication code exists and judges whether the CT2 terminal is a registered subscriber terminal(312). If the CT2 terminal is a registered subscriber terminal, the management part transmits a location trace signal to the CT2 terminal(313). If the location trace signal is received(304), the control part detects a base station authentication code from the location trace signal and forms a link(305). Then the control part checks whether a power-off key is inputted(306). If the power-off key is inputted, the control part sends a location registration release signal to the WPBX(307).

column12: METHOD FOR AUTOMATICALLY SETTING LINK IN ACCORDANCE WITH REGISTRATION MODE IN CT-2
column13: PURPOSE: A method for automatically setting up a link according to a registered mode in an advanced digital wireless telephone is provided to automatically attempt and set up links for all the registered slots sequentially, irrespective of base station modes. CONSTITUTION: A control part attempts a link to a slot of the first base station mode(301). If the link is successful, the control part sets up the link to the slot(303). In case that the link is failed, however, the control part checks whether another registered slot of the first base station mode exists(305). In case that another slot is registered, the control part changes the failed slot with another registered slot(306) and attempts a link to the registered slot(307). The control part checks whether links are attempted for all the registered slots of the first base station mode. In case that the link attempts for all the registered slots of the first base station mode are completed, the control part checks whether a registered slot of the second base station mode exists(309). If a registered slot exists, the control part attempts a link to the registered slot(311).

column13: PURPOSE: A rainwater reusing system for a green building is provided to collect and efficiently reuse rainwater falling on a new building constructed under a green building certification system, thereby satisfying requirements for using the rainwater in a water resource field of a green building certification. CONSTITUTION: A rainwater reusing system for a green building includes a screen tank(10), a grit chamber(20), a flow rate adjustment tank(30), a filtration tank(40), a disinfection tank(50), and a water storage tank(60). The screen tank removes suspended matters included in rainwater supplied after initial rainwater is excluded. The grit chamber deposits and removes sand and soil included in the rainwater from which the suspended matters are removed. The flow rate adjustment tank controls a sudden increase in the amount of the rainwater flowing from the grit chamber. The flow rate adjustment tank implements the sedimentation of sludge and the prevention of decomposition with air supplied from an air diffuser(31). The filtration tank comprises a DSF(Dynamic Sand Filter), and passes the rainwater from the flow rate adjustment tank through a fiber bundle in order to remove minute particles. The disinfection tank sterilizes the rainwater from the filtration tank with UV(Ultraviolet) rays. The water storage tank keeps the rainwater, which is finally treated by the UV rays, for a certain period of time, and then discharges the rainwater so that the rainwater can be reused as residential water, industrial/agricultural/landscaping water, and fire fighting water.
